data.title: SAM's Vision: Boosting Thailand's role in aerospace and semiconductor equipment
data.description: Join us for an exclusive interview with Mr. Peter Lim, CEO of SAM Engineering & Equipment Berhad, as he shares his strategic vision for driving growth in the aerospace and semiconductor sectors.

data.title: Pita reaches out to Ubon Ratchathani voters for PAO chief election
data.description: Former Move Forward Party leader Pita Limjaroenrat asked Ubon Ratchathani province locals to turn out in large numbers and cast their ballots for their preferred Provincial Administrative Organisation (PAO) presidential candidate.

data.title: Tourists turn out in full force at Doi Pui for overnight stay
data.description: Cool mornings, breathtaking scenery a big draw on Doi Suthep

data.title: Seven traffic policemen suspended over alleged assault
data.description: Seven traffic policemen faced temporary suspension from their duties for physically assaulting innocent people, according to an order signed by Traffic Police chief Pol Maj-General Surachet Bandit on Friday.

data.title: Snowfall in Europe drying up as climate change take a toll
data.description: Snowfall declined sharply after 1980, coinciding with a rapid rise in temperatures, says study

data.title: Doctor who donated his body for research wins plaudits
data.description: Krittai Thanasombatkul, a medical doctor who became a best-selling author about maintaining his fighting spirit as he battled last-stage lung cancer, received praise among people even though he passed away last year.

data.title: South Korean prosecutors detain ex-defense chief over martial law imposition
data.description: South Korean prosecutors on Sunday detained a former defense minister who allegedly recommended last week’s brief but stunning martial law imposition to President Yoon Suk Yeol, making him the first figure detained over the case, news reports said.

data.title: Thailand’s rice yields considerably lower than other countries
data.description: Department of Rice sees high potential to promote coloured varieties

data.title: Bangkok among the ‘best cities in Southeast Asia’ for tourists
data.description: Indian news channel names region’s top cities

data.title: Syrian insurgents claim entry into Damascus; residents report gunfire sounds
data.description: Syrian insurgents said early Sunday that they had entered Damascus, capping a stunning advance across the country, as residents of the capital reported sounds of gunfire and explosions.

data.title: Busy young professionals in China turn to sport to boost social circles
data.description: Among these sports, cycling is growing as a popular choice.

data.title: Discarded fishing nets recycled for various products in Japan
data.description: Alliance for the Blue, a Tokyo-based general incorporated association, works to encourage companies to use fabrics made from recycled fishing nets.

data.title: 4 tourist spots in popular Asian countries to quench your wanderlust
data.description: There comes a time when the well-known holiday hotspots do not meet the standards and you are spent wishing for a fulfilling travel experience. To shake things up, add these off-the-beaten tourist destinations to your itinerary for a meaningful and adventure-packed getaway!

data.title: Discarded fishing nets recycled for various products in Japan
data.description: Alliance for the Blue, a Tokyo-based general incorporated association, works to encourage companies to use fabrics made from recycled fishing nets.

data.title: Brilliant Panot stays ahead in boys’ A class at JAT-NB3 Elite Series
data.description: Panot Sukanant delivered a stellar performance to maintain his Boys’ A Class dominance at the fourth JAT-NB3 Elite Series at Lotus Valley Golf Resort on Saturday.

data.title: Casual thief; random kill; pesky neighbour; headless end
data.description: Trying out his luck

data.title: MNDAA sentences 21 people for crimes in Laukkai, including six to death
data.description: The Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army (MNDAA) has publicly sentenced 21 people convicted of kidnapping, extortion and murder in Laukkai, with six of them executed on December 5, according to the Kokang News Agency.

data.title: Impeachment prospects for President Yoon dim as ruling party boycotts vote
data.description: Most ruling party lawmakers were boycotting a parliamentary vote Saturday to deny a two-thirds majority sought by the opposition to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over his short-lived imposition of martial law, as protests grew nationwide calling for his removal.

data.title: Historic $100-bn boost for International Development Association
data.description: World Bank says amount will be deployed in 78 countries, to assist in key areas

data.title: BMA announces Green Festival 2024
data.description: Festival December 13-15 aims to promote the conservation of large trees as the lifeblood and lungs of communities

data.title: Government to implement measures against illegal ‘nominees’
data.description: Major discussion on issue set for Monday, December 9

data.title: Bus stop controversy in Samut Prakan goes viral
data.description: Contractor poured concrete that levelled up with seating area, making it impossible to use

data.title: Myanmar yet to return four detained Thai fishermen
data.description: Situation remains uncertain, and process depends on Myanmar government

data.title: Pygmy hippo Moo Deng among NY Times’ Most Stylish People of 2024
data.description: List of ‘63 Most Stylish People of 2024’ published by New York Times website on Thursday

data.title: 2nd phase of 10,000-baht handout to happen before Feb, govt insists
data.description: Rumours on social media that government has no money to continue the handout campaign denied

data.title: Phumtham seeks closer security ties with Sweden
data.description: In meeting with ambassador, defence minister hails progress in security and defence industry cooperation

data.title: CP Foods leads sustainable environmental care on Thai Environment Day
data.description: Charoen Pokphand Foods Public Company Limited (CP Foods) is uniting with all sectors to drive environmental stewardship, and jointly creating a better, more sustainable future for all life on Earth. This effort marks “Thai Environment Day” on December 4, followed by World Soil Day on December 5th—highlighting the vital importance of our environment.

data.title: Thai pilots oppose permission for foreigners to fly domestic routes
data.description: Association seeks review of decision, denies shortage of local pilots

data.description: The joyous season is around the corner and Guru By Bangkok Post has a list of gifts for everyone on your list

data.description: Officials clarify that move under consideration was not designed for Yingluck’s return

data.title: Moroccan man flees Thailand after allegedly strangling boyfriend to death
data.description: Interpol help sought as suspect fled the country on Wednesday

data.title: Thai Vietjet, BAC launch pilot training programme in Thailand
data.description: Airline plans to hire 20 pilots from first batch of cadets

data.title: UNESCO experts to check proposed high-speed railway station site
data.description: Inspection aimed at ensuring project does not affect Ayutthaya Historical Park

data.title: Thailand celebrates UNESCO recognition for ‘Tom Yum Kung’ and Kebaya
data.description: The Ministry of Culture is hosting a celebration from Friday to Sunday to mark the inclusion of Tom Yum Kung and Kebaya on UNESCO's Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity at Quartier Avenue, EmQuartier Mall in Bangkok.

data.title: Upper Thailand to be in the grip of a cold spell from Sunday
data.description: South will get a respite from heavy rains today

data.title: EGAT and GIZ celebrate CIF’s success, expanding green cooling innovation network toward carbon neutrality
data.description: EGAT, in collaboration with the German Corporation for International Cooperation (GIZ), highlights the success of Cooling Innovation Fund (CIF) and Green Cooling Initiative (GCI) III, advancing Thailand’s air-conditioning and cooling industry toward green cooling technology.

data.title: Laos and Thailand join hands to develop industrial cattle production chain
data.description: Laos and Thailand have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) on developing the industrial cattle production chain, marking a significant step towards advancing the cattle production industry in both countries.

data.title: Thailand ready for another thumping success in AFF Cup
data.description: AFF Mitsubishi Electric Cup (AMEC) defending champions Thailand will kick off their defence of the title on Sunday when Masatada Ishii’s side travel to Vietnam to take on Timor-Leste in their opening game in Group A.
